title: Charmides by Plato
description: Charmides (ΧΑΡΜΙΔΗΣ) is a Socratic dialogue written by Plato which discusses the virtues of temperance, modesty and self control. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Painting: The Daughter of the Painter by Charles Joshua Chaplin.
content:encoded: Charmides (ΧΑΡΜΙΔΗΣ) is a Socratic dialogue written by Plato which discusses the virtues of temperance, modesty and self control. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Painting: The Daughter of the Painter by Charles Joshua Chaplin.
itunes:subtitle: The handsome and popular Charmides (ΧΑΡΜΙΔΗΣ) who was also Plato's uncle discusses temperance, self-control and restraint with Socrates (ΣΩΚΡΑΤΗΣ).
